intro: Globba spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed globba, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Globba spathulata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
